description:
'''Abrar-ul-Haq''' ({{langx|pa|{{Nastaliq|ابرار الحق}}}}) is a Pakistani singer-songwriter, philanthropist, and a politician. 

His debut 1995 album ''[[Billo De Ghar]]'' sold over 40.3{{nbsp}}million albums worldwide, which made him a household name and granted him the title of "King of [[Pakistani pop]]".

Abrar-ul-Haq is the founder and chairman of Sahara for Life Trust, a private organization that has been providing health services to the people of Narowal and surrounding areas since 1998. He was [[Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf]]'s candidate for the seat of [[National Assembly of Pakistan|National Assembly]] from constituency [[NA-78 (Narowal-II)]] in the [[2018 Pakistani general election]].
